sn1.36:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
sn1.36:1.2: Then, late at night, several glorious deities of the Satullapa Group, lighting up the entire Jeta’s Grove, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and stood to one side.
sn1.36:1.3: Standing to one side, one deity recited this verse in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.36:2.4: and when they discard this corpse they go to heaven.”
sn1.36:3.1: Then another deity recited these verses in the Buddha’s presence:
sn1.36:4.1: “Give up anger, get rid of conceit,
sn1.36:4.2: and get past all the fetters.
sn1.36:4.3: Chains don’t torment one who has nothing,
sn1.36:4.4: not clinging to name and form.”
